creator: ZacharyA22
title: Wireless Safety Button for PLC Safety
materials_required: PLC w/power supply - Allen-Bradley CompactLogix PLC
description: This project demonstrates a proof of concept for using IoT to create an additional layer of safety for hazardous manufacturing facilities. It uses a wireless safety button to start or stop processes controlled by a PLC.
steps: Wire the NODE MCU server circuit: Use a NODE MCU board as the server, which acts as the middleman between the button and the PLC. When the button is pushed, the server will energize a relay, sending a signal to the PLC to stop all processes. Wire the relay to the NODE MCU using a transistor to amplify the signal. Connect the central pin of the relay to the 24v source and the NO pin to input terminal 1 on the PLC.

Wire the NODE MCU client circuit: Program the other NODE MCU board as the client. Connect a 9v battery to the Vin and GND pins. Solder wires from the 3v3 pin and pin D8 (GPIO 15) to either side of the normally closed emergency button.

Wire the PLC: Plug the green wire from the NC relay leg into input terminal 0 of your PLC and connect to ground via the common port. Attach a normally open push button to terminal 1 as a start button. Connect an output device (e.g., a pilot light) to output terminal 0 and add a connection to ground at COM.

Program the NODE MCU server and client: Download the server and client files to the respective boards, changing the SSID, password, IP, gateway, and subnet mask as needed. If different pins are used, adjust the variable assignments in the code.
Program the PLC: Download and install Studio 5000. Connect the PLC to your computer via USB. Open the provided code, select your PLC, and download the code. Set the PLC to 'run'.
Run the project: Attach a 9v battery to the client board, plug in the server board and the PLC, and run the PLC program. Test the emergency button to ensure the output device deactivates.
